body_content.explanation: to load (= put) information or a program onto a computer before it is sold or used:
examples: Teachers preload lessons onto these wall-length computer screens.
The console comes pre-loaded with music and videos.

body_content.explanation: to fill a container, etc. with something before moving or sending it somewhere else:
examples: The vaccine is preloaded into syringes.
On large planes, metal containers are preloaded with bags.

body_content.explanation: to have food or drink, especially alcoholic drink, before doing something or going out somewhere:
examples: You've got to preload before you get to a bar because you can't drink once you go in.
